hymn.title: Come, O Thou Traveler unknown
hymn.chords: | C - - - | C - C/E - | F - C/E - | Am - G - | D7 - G - | G7/B - C - | A7/C# - D B | Em - - Am | Em/B B7 Em - | C - F/A - | D - G - | C/E F C/G Am | G7 - C - |

layout.singingstanza: Come, O Thou Tra -- vel -- er un -- known, Whom still I hold but can -- not see; My com -- pa -- ny be -- fore is gone, And I am left a -- lone with Thee; With Thee all night I mean to stay, And wres -- tle till the break of day.

lyrics.stanza: Lame as I am, I take the prey; Hell, earth and sin, with ease o'ercome. I leap for joy, pursue my way, And, as a bounding hart, I run, Through all eternity to prove Thy nature and Thy name is Love.
